item.title: Bluetooth 6.1 enhances privacy with randomized RPA timing
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Bluetooth Special Interest Group (SIG) has announced Bluetooth Core Specification 6.1, bringing important improvements to the popular wireless communication protocol. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT is finally adding Download as PDF for Deep Research
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: ChatGPT's Deep Research, which allows you to conduct multi-step research for complex tasks, is finally getting an option to save the report as a PDF. [...]

item.title: iClicker site hack targeted students with malware via fake CAPTCHA
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The website of iClicker, a popular student engagement platform, was compromised in a ClickFix attack that used a fake CAPTCHA prompt to trick students and instructors into installing malware on their devices. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Teams will soon block screen capture during meetings
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is working on adding a new Teams feature that will prevent users from capturing screenshots of sensitive information shared during meetings. [...]

item.title: Fake AI video generators drop new Noodlophile infostealer malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Fake AI-powered video generation tools are being used to distribute a new information-stealing malware family called 'Noodlophile,' under the guise of generated media content. [...]

item.title: Ascension says recent data breach affects over 430,000 patients
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Ascension, one of the largest private healthcare systems in the United States, has revealed that the personal and healthcare information of over 430,000 patients was exposed in a data breach disclosed last month. [...]

item.title: Google Chrome to use on-device AI to detect tech support scams
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google is implementing a new Chrome security feature that uses the built-in 'Gemini Nano' large-language model (LLM) to detect and block tech support scams while browsing the web. [...]

item.title: Police dismantles botnet selling hacked routers as residential proxies
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Law enforcement authorities have dismantled a botnet that infected thousands of routers over the last 20 years to build two networks of residential proxies known as Anyproxy and 5socks. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers behind attacks targeting SAP NetWeaver servers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Forescout Vedere Labs security researchers have linked ongoing attacks targeting a maximum severity vulnerability impacting SAP NetWeaver instances to a Chinese threat actor. [...]

item.title: Germany takes down eXch cryptocurrency exchange, seizes servers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Federal police in Germany (BKA) seized the server infrastructure and shut down the 'eXch' cryptocurrency exchange platform for alleged money laundering cybercrime proceeds. [...]

item.title: FBI: End-of-life routers hacked for cybercrime proxy networks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The FBI warns that threat actors are deploying malware on end-of-life (EoL) routers to convert them into proxies sold on the 5Socks and Anyproxy networks. [...]

item.title: Cisco fixes max severity IOS XE flaw letting attackers hijack devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cisco has fixed a maximum severity flaw in IOS XE Software for Wireless LAN Controllers by a hard-coded JSON Web Token (JWT) that allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to take over devices. [...]
